intro: Thesium adulterinum, commonly known as the false sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pinkish flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions with well-drained conditions. Thesium adulterinum is typically used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
